The WEF (Wi-Fi Exploitation Framework) is a shell-based tool designed for security researchers and penetration testers. It automates and facilitates the analysis and exploitation of vulnerabilities in WPA/WPA2, WPS, and WEP Wi-Fi networks, supporting both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.

Copyparty is a versatile, portable file server that supports multiple protocols including HTTP, WebDAV, SFTP, FTP, and TFTP. It excels at accelerated, resumable uploads and downloads, deduplication, and offers features like media indexing and thumbnail generation, all runnable with just Python.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Uscrapper Vanta is an open-source Python tool designed for comprehensive web scraping, capable of extracting various data points from both the surface and deep web. It leverages multithreading and advanced anti-scraping defenses to gather information like email addresses, social media links, and geolocations, with new support for dark web (.onion) links and keyword-based scraping.

This Python repository is designed to parse posts and comments from VKontakte, filter them by keywords using fuzzy matching and spell checking, and store the results in a MongoDB database. It also includes a Telegram bot for remote management and control.
